title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

Description (1 point)

· Cuckoos are parasites (of the warbler).

· The cuckoo benefits from the relationship, and the warbler is harmed by the relationship.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

Description (1 point)

· Cuckoos are parasites (of the warbler).

· The cuckoo benefits from the relationship, and the warbler is harmed by the relationship.

The student response earns one of the following points:

Description (1 point)

· Cuckoos are parasites (of the warbler).

· The cuckoo benefits from the relationship, and the warbler is harmed by the relationship.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

Graph (2 points)

· Cuckoo added (group 1): Bar must be HIGHER than the “Warblers Only” bar.

· Cuckoo removed (group 2): Bar must be LOWER than the “Warblers and Cuckoos” bar.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

Graph (2 points)

· Cuckoo added (group 1): Bar must be HIGHER than the “Warblers Only” bar.

· Cuckoo removed (group 2): Bar must be LOWER than the “Warblers and Cuckoos” bar.

The student response earns one of the following points:

Graph (2 points)

· Cuckoo added (group 1): Bar must be HIGHER than the “Warblers Only” bar.

· Cuckoo removed (group 2): Bar must be LOWER than the “Warblers and Cuckoos” bar.

The student response earns two of the following points:

Graph (2 points)

· Cuckoo added (group 1): Bar must be HIGHER than the “Warblers Only” bar.

· Cuckoo removed (group 2): Bar must be LOWER than the “Warblers and Cuckoos” bar.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

Identification (1 point)

· Mutualism

· Both organisms benefit
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

Identification (1 point)

· Mutualism

· Both organisms benefit

The student response earns one of the following points:

Identification (1 point)

· Mutualism

· Both organisms benefit
